author: MarsNeedsLEGO
title: The gift(card) of LEGO
review:
I have the 'distinction' of working at a Target store in Texas, and was pleasantly surprised to see this on the giftcard rack one day. I grabbed one and placed it in my shopping basket and headed to the front to checkout.

When told that the minimum amount one can place on a giftcard is five dollars, I was somewhat dismayed. But the cashier cheerfully suggested I put five dollars on the card and use it toward the remainder of my purchases. Brilliant! And that's exactly what I did, making this the first and only LEGO set I've ever acquired at absolutely no cost.

That alone should make it 5/5, but in addition to the value, this set also features some interesting pieces (the white 'teeth' for ears, a printed eye on a 1x1 brick, and the ubiquitous Target bullseye logo printed on another) as well as a nice little plastic box to store them in while disassembled. I can only give it a 4 for playability (being an employee and seeing the dog plastered everywhere does tend to diminish its charm), but otherwise I highly recommend this set. Get it while you can!

author: spad2972
title: Free Legos
review:
The best part is the set is free.  Whatever you pay just gets put on the value of the giftcard.  You can come back the next day and use the giftcard to buy whatever and the LEGOs and box(clear plastic with hinged lid) are yours to keep.

My wife found it for me.  I immediately went back and bought two more (all they had at that particular store).  My sons (4 and 6yrs old) have played with it quite a bit and it holds up very well.

Set is 31 pieces and includes unique 1x1 white brick with Target/bullseye symbol as well as the relatively rare 2x1 white cheese piece.  The rest of the bricks are mostly white and fairly common.

author: MorkMan
title: Well worth the price..
review: This little set popped out at me during Christmas of 2010. I saw it on the end-cap by the greeting cards at my local Target. I pulled it off the hook and took it to an employee nearby. She confirmed that it was a gift card and that I was indeed, free (with a minimum of $5 put on the card). I was the second to last one and she told me that was all they had and wouldn't be getting any more. I didn't pick p the second set. I figured I would spread the love to another Lego fan. It sits on my bookshelf right now and is a great little set to show off. It's a great conversation piece (as if the other dozen sets aren't) sitting on my shelf in my office. I'm happy to own it since it didn't seem to be a huge seller. Is it my favorite piece? No, but it's definitely a cool addition to my collection!
